summary: Frontend-only testing of Login page redesign. Tested all 7 required test cases: desktop layout, left panel content, right panel elements, valid login flow, wrong password inline error, register tab, Google OAuth button, and mobile viewport. All core features are working correctly.

minor.issue: 401 response causes fetch to fall into catch block (likely missing CORS headers on 401 or non-JSON response body), so inline error shows 'Network error. Please try again.' instead of 'Invalid credentials'. InlineError component itself IS working correctly - error IS shown below SIGN IN button.

issues: Form inputs are 215px wide on 375px viewport due to compounded padding (56px panel left/right + 24px form-wrap). Form is still functional and readable, but inputs feel narrow. Consider reducing right-panel padding on mobile to just the form-wrap 24px.

action_items: Optional: Fix 401 CORS headers in backend so wrong-password shows specific auth error message instead of 'Network error' in the inline error component
critical_code_review_comments: Login.jsx is 1003 lines but well-structured with sub-components (FormInput, CTAButton, InlineError, OrDivider, LeftPanel) - acceptable
Catch block shows 'Network error' for 401 responses - backend should return JSON error body with CORS headers for all auth responses
useLoginStyles() injects styles via useEffect on mount - correct approach to avoid SSR issues

success_rate.frontend: 95% (all core features pass, 1 minor design note on mobile padding)

context_for_next_testing_agent: Login page redesign is complete and working. All test cases pass: desktop layout (left 55% / right 45%), headline with volt-green 'smarter.', stats strip (2W·3W·4W / EFI / System Operational), LOGIN/REGISTER tabs, email+password inputs with icons, eye toggle, forgot password link, volt-green SIGN IN button, OR divider, Google OAuth button, footer links, inline error below SIGN IN on wrong creds, mobile (375px) hides left panel and shows BATTWHEELS OS top bar. Valid login admin@battwheels.in/admin redirects to /dashboard with 'Welcome back!' toast. Only note: wrong-password inline error shows 'Network error' instead of specific message due to 401 CORS issue.
